DOCNAME: CASE OF MILISAVLJEVIC v. BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively . While the first applicant lives in GPE , her sons , the second and the third applicants , live in GPE , in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the local authorities expropriated an apartment in GPE which was occupied ( but not owned ) by the applicants . The local planning authorities were ordered to allocate the first applicant a suitable replacement apartment . This decision entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant initiated court proceedings seeking the allocation to her by the local planning authorities of a suitable replacement apartment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that , while it was clear that the local planning authorities were required to allocate the first applicant a suitable replacement apartment , the courts of law had no power to designate such an apartment . ORG , consequently , declined jurisdiction . This decision entered into force on DATE when ORG upheld it .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant complained to ORG about non - enforcement of the administrative decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found breaches of LAW No . CARDINAL to the Convention . It ordered ORG a constituent Entity of Bosnia and Herzegovina ) to allocate , or to cause the local planning authorities to allocate , to the first applicant a suitable replacement apartment at the latest within DATE . ORG awarded the first applicant , in pecuniary damage , CARDINAL convertible marks ( BAM ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) plus BAM CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL ) per month from DATE until DATE in which she was to be allocated a suitable replacement apartment . She was further awarded BAM CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( approximately ORG CARDINAL ) in respect of non - pecuniary damage . Lastly , she was awarded default interest on the above amounts at an DATE rate of PERCENT . This decision entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the local planning authorities offered the first applicant a tenancy of an apartment in GPE . On DATE the applicant rejected the offer .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG paid the following amounts to the first applicant : BAM CARDINAL in respect of pecuniary damage , BAM CARDINAL in respect of non - pecuniary damage and default interest on the above amounts at the rate indicated in ORG decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the interpretation of the order to allocate , or to cause the local planning authorities to allocate , to the first applicant a suitable replacement apartment set out in FAC decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the legal successor of ORG , ORG within ORG , explained that in accordance with ORG decision the first applicant should be given ownership of a suitable apartment and not only a tenancy .
CARDINAL . On DATE the local planning authorities offered the first applicant a tenancy of the same apartment as on DATE . The applicant has not accepted the offer .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant filed a criminal complaint against ORG with ORG of GPE ( non - enforcement of a final and enforceable decision of ORG constitutes a criminal offence ) . It would appear that no decision has been taken in that regard .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG paid an additional amount of BAM CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL to the first applicant in respect of pecuniary damage ( that is , BAM CARDINAL per month for the period from DATE until DATE plus default interest on those DATE amounts at the rate indicated in ORG decision ) .
CARDINAL . The relevant law and practice were outlined in GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) also concerning the non - enforcement of ORG decision .
